name: The George Hotel

reviews.text: Not only is this hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing as all the main attractions of Edinburgh are within short walking distance, but it is also convenient for links to the airport and for locally organised tours. It is a tidy and well kept hotel, and recently refurbished. The rooms are comfy and clean and the service was efficient, courteous and professional. The restaurant is also pretty good. Overall, i had a great stay and would happily return.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had stayed at the George in November 2008 for business and been quite impressed, so decided to go back with my husband in February 2009 for pleasure. We booked the "treat your partner" package, which meant you got a free cocktail and rose petals and chocolates in the bedroom. We arrived too early to check in and were able to leave our bags without problem, though there was an implication by the receptionist that we should have known we couldn't get into the room (we did know, and we also knew they'd look after our bags for us.) When we got to our room there were no rose petals and no chocolates, which made us wonder if we'd booked the right package, although we'd been given the voucher for the free cocktail (only one per person, even though we'd booked for 2 nights - I think you should get one per night of stay). My husband eventually went down to reception to see if we had made an error and were told that we hadn't. Reception apologised and arranged for chocolates to be sent up, though this wasn't quite the same of course as having them in the room when we arrived - my husband made the point that this would have been particularly disappointing if it had been a surprise for me. I did wonder if they would do it for our second day to make it up to us, but our room was bare when we returned on the second day. The room was nice, though a bit small (but I knew that from my previous stay). The beds are comfortable. I don't mind no minibar though I do think free mineral water should be provided by any establishment. That said, there's a Sainsburys round the corner where you can pick up 2 litre bottles of water for 37p. Breakfast was good, though I would prefer not to be given the inquisition about room number and name etc - how many people do they really have sneaking in for a free breakfast? It doesn't make you feel very welcome.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, needs a bit of attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have problems with big queues for reception or the concierge. If you are on the front of the hotel you might have problems with noise - especially as the buses have been rerouted from Princes St for the Edinburgh tramworks. Although the buses didn';t bother us, we were woken up by clubbers on our first night so think about asking for a room at the back.
reviews.title: Good, But Not Great

reviews.text: My biggest gripe was the fact that there was a fire alarm at 11.30 on our second night. It (presumably, as I am still here to tell the tale) was a false alarm but nobody bothered to tell us and there was no notice apologising for the false alarm when we went down to breakfast the next day, which would have been an easy thing for the hotel to have done. As I said in the title, attention to detail is lacking. A bit more care and the hotel could be really good.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early , room not ready we did not expect so this was fine as we were heading off for the day anyhow.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay, Would Highly Recomend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a one night stay in the beautiful George Hotel. We were on one of their packages where you get an Executive room and a complimentary cocktail/glass of champagne in the bar. It is a lovely hotel and very well situated. George Street is full of great bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived (way too early to check in!) the staff were very friendly and helpful. They firstly checked to see if our room was ready (it was not but we were not expecting it to be) and then looked after our case while we wandered around the city, shopping and sightseeing. They also did the same after check out which was great as we were not leaving Edinburgh until 8pm.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was fabulous - beautifully decorated, with a huge bed, flat screen TV, lovely bathroom, fluffy white towels, nice toiletries, tea & coffee facilities. We were on the first floor but it was surprisingly quiet.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was great - loads of choice and cooked to perfection. All the staff greeted you with a friendly "good morning" and a smile.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely return to the George next time we go to Edinburgh.
reviews.title: Treat yourself in the heart of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was perfect: room, breakfast, Tempus Bar, location, helpful staff.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience...

reviews.text: Great value for money having paid 150€/ night.
reviews.title: Good option for business travellers, too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here and used the meeting facilities for one day/night. I arrived VERY early and asked to store my bags somewhere - reception actually checked me in and let me use my room, as it was available. I appreciate this wouldn't always be the case, but it was good of them to do it - and also useful as it meant I could get online and do some work. Internet access is priced reasonably (compared to some of the major chain hotels). Meeting room was good - and business centre staff very helpful.
reviews.title: Luxurious, Welcoming and very enjoyable!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom was small(ish) but spotless and comfortable. Very comfy bed. I used room service for dinner and breakfast (as I was leaving very early) and the service was quick. I found the room service food to be of a very good standard. All the staff I met were extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Fantastic City Break & Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a bit of street noise (mainly traffic) from George Street but not too bad. The hotel is in a good location to go and have a little stroll about in the evening (as a single female business traveller I don't often find this to be the case with out of town or some City Centre hotels).
reviews.title: vg hotel, tremendous location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading a couple of poor reviews on this hotel from possibly over fussy people I' like to say that we stayed at the George at last years comedy festival and found everything about it excellent. So good we are returning for a few days tomorrow. Although Edinburgh itself is our main purpose of our visit The George hotel itself plays a large part in why we are returning to Edinburgh.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. We are on our way back already!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simon & Annette.
reviews.title: worst 4* hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A small room looking out onto a wall! Not enough clothes storage space. Tea making tray in the wardrobe! Heating system which we were informed would take, half an hour to heat up, so we sat in our coats.
reviews.title: How utterly dissapointing
Gorgeous George
reviews.text: The bathroom was OK very modern and lots of hot water.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food, Oh dear! first morning asked for tea, which we got - poured into our cups from a flask - remember this is a 4* hotel. On requesting a teapot of fresh tea were were informed that " this is the way we do things here". After discussion the waitress begrudgingly went off to see if a pot of tea would be allowed!!! Hot food was on cold plates, luke warm and self service. The supervisor was less than sympathetic. The next two breakfasts were not much better.
reviews.title: Superb...would definetely return

description: The George Hotel has one of the most prestigious locations within Edinburgh. It's classic facade hides sumptuous, contempary interiors blending clean lines with period features.Elegant bedrooms are beautifully furnished for business and leisure guests alike and for those who choose to dine in, the stylish EH2 Tempus Bar and Restaurant offers local produce in a stylish and relaxed environment.Inspirational meeting rooms and exceptional banqueting facilities, including the magnificent King's Hall and beautiful Panorama Suite with fantastic views of across the city, make this the hotel of choice for corporate and wedding guests.The George is within easy reach of the best shopping the captial has to offer, along with tourist attractions, bars and restaurants all within a few minutes walk. Edinburgh Airport is only 7 miles away, and Edinburgh Waverley Station a mere 5 minutes walk. Parking is available at the nearby NCP at Greenside.
